text: A Vice-President of the European Commission is a member of the European Commission who is in charge of the commission's work in special focus areas where European Commissioners participate. Currently, the European Commission has a total of seven Vice-Presidents: three Executive-Vice Presidents, three regular Vice-Presidents, and the High Representative who is ex officio also one of the Vice-Presidents. ==List of vice-presidents== Legend: – – Commission Entered office Left office Name State Party Hallstein I Hallstein I 7 January 1958 9 January 1962 Sicco Mansholt PvdA Hallstein I 7 January 1958 9 January 1962 Robert Marjolin SFIO Hallstein I 7 January 1958 15 September 1959 Piero Malvestiti DC Hallstein II Hallstein II 10 January 1962 30 June 1967 Sicco Mansholt PvdA Hallstein II 10 January 1962 30 June 1967 Robert Marjolin SFIO Hallstein II 10 January 1962 15 May 1963 Giuseppe Caron DC Hallstein II 30 July 1965 30 June 1967 Lionello Sandri PSI Rey Rey 2 July 1967 30 June 1970 Sicco Mansholt PvdA Rey 2 July 1967 30 June 1970 Lionello Sandri PSI Rey 2 July 1967 30 June 1970 Fritz Hellwig CDU Rey 2 July 1967 30 June 1970 Raymond Barre UDF Rey 2 July 1967 30 June 1970 Wilhelm Haferkamp SPD Malfatti Malfatti 1 July 1970 21 March 1972 Sicco Mansholt PvdA Malfatti 1 July 1970 21 March 1972 Wilhelm Haferkamp SPD Mansholt Mansholt 22 March 1972 5 January 1973 Wilhelm Haferkamp SPD Ortoli Ortoli 6 January 1973 5 January 1977 Patrick Hillery FF Ortoli 6 January 1973 5 January 1977 Wilhelm Haferkamp SPD Ortoli 6 January 1973 5 January 1977 Henri Simonet PS Ortoli 6 January 1973 5 January 1977 Christopher Soames Con.
